article.title: Methods of Information Handling
article.author: Bourne, C.P.
article.text: This book is meant to be an aid and reference work for those people who are interested in the design of information systems. Such information systems are typified by the traditional libraries, but the same problems of information processing, storage, and retrieval are present in many government and industrial organizations in many places besides the library. This book provides an illustration of the tools, equipment, and methodology that might be applied to those problems.
